original_title: STF Cracks Phone Smuggling Ring: Over 300 New and Used Devices Recovered
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Officers from the Police Special Task Force attached to the Sri Jayawardenepura STF Camp apprehended two suspects attempting to smuggle a large quantity of mobile phones through Peliyagoda, Sri Lanka.
The duo, identified as residents of Colombo 12 and Wattala, aged 21 and 43 respectively, were nabbed during a spot vehicle check on the Negombo-Colombo main road.
Utilizing an instant roadblock, vigilant officers honed in on a suspicious van, prompting a thorough inspection.
Their suspicions were confirmed when they uncovered a staggering 246 brand-new mobile phones, hidden within the vehicle.
Further investigation revealed an additional 77 used mobile phones, presumably brought in from abroad, all intended to bypass Sri Lanka's duty  regulations.
The van itself, used as a transport tool for the illicit goods, was also seized as evidence.
Both suspects were immediately taken into custody and are currently undergoing interrogation.
